intro: Jacquemontia houseana, commonly known as the purpleleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its twining stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces violet to purple blooms that open in the morning and close in the afternoon. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a distinctive purple tinge, adding to its ornamental appeal. Jacquemontia houseana thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
